00029 /*
00030  * This file is part of Lustre, http://www.lustre.org/
00031  * Lustre is a trademark of Sun Microsystems, Inc.
00032  *
00033  * lustre/obdclass/lprocfs_counters.c
00034  *
00035  * Lustre lprocfs counter routines
00036  *
00037  * Author: Andreas Dilger <andreas.dilger@intel.com>
00038  */
00039 #include <linux/module.h>
00040 #include <lustre_lib.h>
00041 #include <lprocfs_status.h>
00042 
00043 #ifdef CONFIG_PROC_FS
00044 void lprocfs_counter_add(struct lprocfs_stats *stats, int idx, long amount)
00045 {
00046         struct lprocfs_counter          *percpu_cntr;
00047         struct lprocfs_counter_header   *header;
00048         int                             smp_id;
00049         unsigned long                   flags = 0;
00050 
00051         if (stats == NULL)
00052                 return;
00053 
00054         LASSERTF(0 <= idx && idx < stats->ls_num,
00055                  "idx %d, ls_num %hu\n", idx, stats->ls_num);
00056 
00057         /* With per-client stats, statistics are allocated only for
00058          * single CPU area, so the smp_id should be 0 always. */
00059         smp_id = lprocfs_stats_lock(stats, LPROCFS_GET_SMP_ID, &flags);
00060         if (smp_id < 0)
00061                 return;
00062 
00063         header = &stats->ls_cnt_header[idx];
00064         percpu_cntr = lprocfs_stats_counter_get(stats, smp_id, idx);
00065         percpu_cntr->lc_count++;
00066 
00067         if (header->lc_config & LPROCFS_CNTR_AVGMINMAX) {
00068                 /*
00069                  * lprocfs_counter_add() can be called in interrupt context,
00070                  * as memory allocation could trigger memory shrinker call
00071                  * ldlm_pool_shrink(), which calls lprocfs_counter_add().
00072                  * LU-1727.
00073                  *
00074                  * Only obd_memory uses LPROCFS_STATS_FLAG_IRQ_SAFE
00075                  * flag, because it needs accurate counting lest memory leak
00076                  * check reports error.
00077                  */
00078                 if (in_interrupt() &&
00079                     (stats->ls_flags & LPROCFS_STATS_FLAG_IRQ_SAFE) != 0)
00080                         percpu_cntr->lc_sum_irq += amount;
00081                 else
00082                         percpu_cntr->lc_sum += amount;
00083 
00084                 if (header->lc_config & LPROCFS_CNTR_STDDEV)
00085                         percpu_cntr->lc_sumsquare += (__s64)amount * amount;
00086                 if (amount < percpu_cntr->lc_min)
00087                         percpu_cntr->lc_min = amount;
00088                 if (amount > percpu_cntr->lc_max)
00089                         percpu_cntr->lc_max = amount;
00090         }
00091         lprocfs_stats_unlock(stats, LPROCFS_GET_SMP_ID, &flags);
00092 }
00093 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lprocfs_counter_add);
00094 
00095 void lprocfs_counter_sub(struct lprocfs_stats *stats, int idx, long amount)
00096 {
00097         struct lprocfs_counter          *percpu_cntr;
00098         struct lprocfs_counter_header   *header;
00099         int                             smp_id;
00100         unsigned long                   flags = 0;
00101 
00102         if (stats == NULL)
00103                 return;
00104 
00105         LASSERTF(0 <= idx && idx < stats->ls_num,
00106                  "idx %d, ls_num %hu\n", idx, stats->ls_num);
00107 
00108         /* With per-client stats, statistics are allocated only for
00109          * single CPU area, so the smp_id should be 0 always. */
00110         smp_id = lprocfs_stats_lock(stats, LPROCFS_GET_SMP_ID, &flags);
00111         if (smp_id < 0)
00112                 return;
00113 
00114         header = &stats->ls_cnt_header[idx];
00115         percpu_cntr = lprocfs_stats_counter_get(stats, smp_id, idx);
00116         if (header->lc_config & LPROCFS_CNTR_AVGMINMAX) {
00117                 /*
00118                  * Sometimes we use RCU callbacks to free memory which calls
00119                  * lprocfs_counter_sub(), and RCU callbacks may execute in
00120                  * softirq context - right now that's the only case we're in
00121                  * softirq context here, use separate counter for that.
00122                  * bz20650.
00123                  *
00124                  * Only obd_memory uses LPROCFS_STATS_FLAG_IRQ_SAFE
00125                  * flag, because it needs accurate counting lest memory leak
00126                  * check reports error.
00127                  */
00128                 if (in_interrupt() &&
00129                     (stats->ls_flags & LPROCFS_STATS_FLAG_IRQ_SAFE) != 0)
00130                         percpu_cntr->lc_sum_irq -= amount;
00131                 else
00132                         percpu_cntr->lc_sum -= amount;
00133         }
00134         lprocfs_stats_unlock(stats, LPROCFS_GET_SMP_ID, &flags);
00135 }
00136 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lprocfs_counter_sub);
00137 #endif  /* CONFIG_PROC_FS */
